medical_history.chief_complaint: Myalgias, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain developed over the lateral aspect of the chest wall bilaterally seven months before admission, with soreness to the touch that was not affected by activity or position changes. Symptoms included a lump in her throat and pain radiating to her right ear, resolving after discontinuation of atorvastatin. Symptoms recurred after resuming atorvastatin, along with fatigue and reduced tolerance for exercise. Bilateral shoulder aches and neck and back pain developed after adding ezetimibe and reducing atorvastatin dose. Eleven days before admission, the patient experienced unbearable morning pain and difficulty arising from bed/chairs. Four days prior to admission, she reported worsening shortness of breath with minimal exertion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Myocardial infarction requiring stent placement in the right coronary artery six years prior; breast cancer treated with lumpectomy and radiation ten years prior with no recurrence; pancreatitis and pseudocyst formation requiring hospitalization; endoscopic ampullectomy for ampullary adenoma eight months prior; atrial fibrillation controlling with metoprolol six weeks prior; history of anxiety, depression, osteoarthritis, and gastroesophageal reflux.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and aunt had breast cancer; father and two brothers had coronary artery disease; sister died of lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Retired widow, lives alone; son and daughter well; never smoked; rarely drinks alcohol.
